engagement_grid._comment: G1: Who was engaged and how

behavioral_health_assessment._comment: G3: How behavioral health needs were assessed
behavioral_health_assessment.admin_data_sources: We currently work with the Lawrence Police Department, Essex County Sheriffs Department, and Lawrence Methuen Community Coalition who use SIMS and CompStat data platforms that collects all data, statistics, and disparities. We share the data in our weekly meetings.
behavioral_health_assessment.other_methods: We attend weekly meetings with all our Community Partners, Medical Staff from Hospital and Health Center, to identify mental health conditions, substance use disorders, and other behavioral health needs. In these meeting we also discuss any barriers, wrap around services, harm reduction, SUD, treatments, and daily street community outreach worker efforts.
behavioral_health_assessment.barriers: The barriers we encountered were that some OUD population did not have health insurance or a phone. These residents have been historically disadvantaged by race, wealth, and stigma. We address those barriers by having our Street Community Outreach workers connect them to wrap around services at the local Lawrence General Hospital and Health Center. Some outreach workers assisted in filling out Mass health applications and connected them to the appropriate health services navigator at the hospital for additional services. We will continue to work with our Street Outreach Team, Hospital, and the Police Department to provide wrap around services.

planning.process: Our municipality conducted its own planning process.

how_spent: Expand mobile intervention, treatment, telehealth treatment, and recovery services offered by qualified providers, including recovery coaches
Support evidence-based withdrawal management services for people with OUD and co-occurring mental health conditions
Support bereaved families and frontline care providers
Supported programs, policies, and practices that have demonstrated effectiveness in preventing drug misuse among youth
Supported community-based education or intervention services for families, youth, and adolescents at risk for OUD

administrative.job_title: Housing Manager, Manger of Financial & Administrative Services, Finance Officer, Project Officer, Community Development Director, MHTF Coordinator

how_spent: Other (please describe): clean up of encampments and library auditorium after use as shelter

additional_comments.general: We would like explore opportunities to pool funds with other communities that have not implemented the use of these funds.
additional_comments.orrf_recommendations: Increased prevention efforts especially among youth. More support for families who have lost a loved one to the opioid epidemic.
